perturbation.original_text: "Affiliate" means, when used with respect to any specified Person, a Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls,  is controlled by, or is under common control with, such specified Person. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms  "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the
perturbation.changed_text: "Affiliate" means, when used with respect to any specified Person, a Person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, has a business association with such specified Person. For the purposes of this definition, "control" (including the terms  "controlled by" and "under common control with") with respect to the
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Affiliate' hinges on 'control,' which is well-defined in corporate law, especially concerning ownership and voting rights. The modified definition replaces 'controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with' with 'has a business association with.' This phrase is vague and subjective, potentially leading to disputes over whether a particular entity qualifies as an affiliate. This vague relationship does not align with standard definitions of 'affiliate' under corporate law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Corporate Law - Definition of Affiliate and Control

perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall monitor and censor all Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including  without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor shall also have the right to monitor and censor Content of the websites associated with  Licensed Domain Names. Licensee shall remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene  or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites as soon as possible after it becomes  aware of such offending Content but in no event later than the timeframe prescribed by the Governmental Authority after receipt of oral or written  notice from Licensor or such Governmental Authority. Licensee's failure to comply with this Section 3.3(a) shall be deemed a material breach of  this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing obligations, Licensee acknowledges that Licensor shall have the right to remove such offending  Content from the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee may, at its discretion, monitor Content on the websites associated with the Licensed Domain Names, including  without limitation Content posted by end users. Licensor may also, at its discretion, monitor Content of the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names. Licensee shall endeavor to remove any offending Content, including, but not limited to, any illegal materials, pornographic, obscene  or sexually explicit materials, materials of a violent nature, or politically sensitive materials, from such websites as soon as possible after it becomes  aware of such offending Content. Licensee's failure to comply with this Section 3.3(a) shall not be deemed a material breach of  this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing permissions, Licensee acknowledges that Licensor shall have the option to remove such offending  Content from the websites associated with Licensed Domain Names.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the 'Licensee shall monitor and censor all content.' The modified text introduces 'may, at its discretion' and 'endeavor to remove', weakening the obligation. Similarly, failure to comply was 'deemed a material breach' is now 'shall not be deemed a material breach'. This shift from a mandatory obligation to a discretionary one contradicts regulatory expectations around content control, especially concerning illegal or politically sensitive content in China, where the regulations are strict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Internet Content Regulations in China (e.g., Provisions on the Administration of Internet Information Services)

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter shall be governed by,  and construed in accordance with, the laws of the People's Republic of China (without regard to its conflicts of laws rules that would mandate the  application of the laws of another jurisdiction).
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement and any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with it or its subject matter shall be interpreted according to general business principles.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that the laws of the People's Republic of China govern the contract. The modified version states that the contract is to be 'interpreted according to general business principles.' This change removes a specific legal framework for enforcement, potentially creating uncertainty and making the agreement difficult to enforce, as 'general business principles' are not a legally defined standard.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law of the People's Republic of China
